whiteRhinoHunting.title: White Rhino Hunting
content: There was no quotes for the white rhino hunting which caused an average of 83 white rhino/year hunts across both countries in the six years 2012-2017.
In 2020 both SA and Namibia reported lower number of hunts due to covid restriction by the government in international leisure travel.

blackRhinoHunting.title: Black Rhino Hunting
content: Over the last six years, an average of 4.8 black rhinos/year have been hunted in the two countries.
SA used 69.2% (45 black)  of the total hunting.

applicantHuntingVertical.title: Average number of South African white rhino hunting applications per year
content: In South Africa from 2009 to 2017 hunters applications were from 15 countries.
South Africa reported 39 countries that had hunters entering the rhino trophy hunting market.
From 2018 to 2021 Namibia and South Africa had clients from 34 countries hunting rhinos.

applicantHuntingHorizontal.title: South African white rhino hunting applications per year
content: 2006 in South Africa Pseudo hunting(hunting to acquire horns for the illegal market), rising steadily to peak in 2011.
Resulted in doubling the number of white rhino hunts in South Africa from 2005 to 2011. Increased number of hunters from non-traditional countries.
South Africa lowered pseudo hunting in 2012 which followed a decrease in white rhino hunt in 2012 to 2015.
After 2012 mostly traditional countries (those that hunted white rhino in 1977-1986 and/or 1991-1993) were involved in pseudo hunting.
